intro: Streptocarpus floribundus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet-blue or white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in spring and summer. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in indirect light and its relatively low maintenance requirements. Streptocarpus floribundus is also known for its ability to produce offsets, which can be propagated to create new plants.
